```{r setup, cache = FALSE, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, tidy = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(message = F, error = F, warning = F, comment = NA, fig.align = 'center', dpi = 100, fig.width=6, fig.height=5, tidy = F, cache.path = '.cache/', fig.path = '../content/ggplottutorial2/')
```

Last term I taught Data Analysis at Andrés Bello National University (UNAB) with Ramón Cornejo-Múñoz. Course material (in spanish) and Rmd files ready to download under Creative Commons.

Using github-pages we were able to create a <a href="http://pachamaltese.github.io/analisis-de-datos-unab/" target="_blank">site project</a> with downloadable and self-contained lectures.
